lead_paragraph: The proposal would create a way for New York City’s estimated 1.4 million private-sector workers who do not have employer-sponsored retirement plans to set aside money in a city-organized program.

headline.print_headline: Mayor Calls for Retirement Savings Plan for Private Workers
headline.main: Mayor De Blasio Proposes Retirement Savings Plan for Private-Sector Workers

snippet: The proposal would create a way for New York City’s estimated 1.4 million private-sector workers who do not have employer-sponsored retirement plans to set aside money in a city-organized program.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio holds conference at which he talks up proposal for around 1.4 million private-sector workers in city to put aside money in city-sponsored retirement savings program; event is directed at federal lawmakers, as de Blasio's plan hinges on change to federal regulations that will allow some cities to create such plans.
